explain: to do something many times to get better at it
to move or act with speed
to make a deep, loud cry or shout
an animal that has fur or hair and makes milk to feed its young
an organ in the body that helps us breathe air
an animal that has feathers and wings
a soft and light covering of a bird
a soft cloth covering that goes over your foot and under your shoe
a small body of still water that is smaller than a lake
the part of a tree that is left in the ground after the rest has been cut down
a bird with webbed feet and a flat bill that lives near water
statement: If you practice hitting the baseball every day, your hitting will get better.
practice

hurried

position

roared

mammals

lungs

bird

sock

pond

stump

duck
